content.body: Remember who you are coming before
Our Father in Heaven…

Guard your steps when you go to the house of God. To draw near to listen is better than to offer the sacrifice of fools, for they do not know that they are doing evil. Be not rash with your mouth, nor let your heart be hasty to utter a word before God, for God is in heaven and you are on earth. Therefore let your words be few.
Spend some time in silence before God
Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth!
…The Lord is in his holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before him.
Praise God that you can spend this time with him in prayer

…since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus,  by a new and living way opened for us through the curtain, that is, his body,  and since we have a great priest over the house of God, let us draw near to God with a sincere heart and with the full assurance that faith brings, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water.
Pray for insight as you open his word.
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
Remember these are God’s words, only he can give understanding, we cannot work it out by our own methods.
Take a moment to consider who the passage is written to – God’s people, the nations, a church an individual?
Put yourself in their shoes and try to hear it as they would have heard it, how they would have felt as they read it - what might have been surprising, shocking, challenging or encouraging for them.
Read passage out loud and slowly, noticing each word.
Write down the surprising things.
Note any repetition.
What was the main point for those it was written to?
Take some time to pray through the passage you have just read.
I will meditate on your precepts and fix my eyes on your ways.
How does the passage you have just read connect with your life?
What did you learn about God? About Jesus? About yourself? Pray that God would root these truths in your heart.
Ask God to change you into someone more like Jesus through his word.
Probe how you have not believed or obeyed this truth.
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
Consider your ways
Ask God to show you specific ways in which you haven't lived this out
Say them out load or write them down
Dig deeper; why have you struggled with this?
Bring these things to God, ask for forgiveness for them.
Pray about the dangers and temptations that you face
Pray for your family, your friends, your church.
Take the words of the passage that you have just been reading and pray it for them.
Use the words of a Psalm or a song of worship to help you praise God
On a piece of paper make a list of the things that you are thankful for today.
Give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
Think about the people that God has put in your life.
Consider what God has been teaching you recently.
Spend some time thinking about God’s character and who he is.
Bring these things to God in praise and thankfulness.
Pray through what has already happened in your week and what is coming up.
Think about the people that God has brought into your week, and those who you will be meeting.
How does what you read earlier help shape your prayers?
Pray for the location that God has place in you in.
…seek the welfare of the city where I have sent you into exile, and pray to the LORD on its behalf, for in its welfare you will find your welfare
What are the needs of your town/city? Bring these things to God.
Pray for your local church, and it’s leaders, pray for your church family as it seeks to share the message of the gospel.
Put on then, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience
Pray that God would increase your love for the place where he has put you; that you would have a deeper love and compassion for the people around you.
How could you use this truth to pray for the world?
We are part of a global church
Pick a particular country or missionaries you know and pray for them now.
Pray for the needs of the country, pray that God’s will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.
End your time as you started- coming before God in praise
Then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God. For the Lord gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding…
Reflect on the passage that you read earlier.
Praise God for his word and ask that he would plant his truth deep in you.
Thank God for the privilege it is to come before him in prayer.
